kowalski.tools.data.xml
Class Sound

java.lang.Object
  kowalski.tools.data.xml.NodeWithExpansionState
      kowalski.tools.data.xml.NodeWithIDAndComments
          kowalski.tools.data.xml.Sound

public class Sound
extends NodeWithIDAndComments

A sound source defined by a set of PCM audio files along with a set of playback behavior parameters.

Java class for Sound complex type.

The following schema fragment specifies the expected content contained within this class. 

 <complexType name="Sound">
   <complexContent>
     <extension base="{}NodeWithIDAndComments">
       <sequence>
         <element ref="{}AudioDataReference" maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0"/>
       </sequence>
       <attribute name="playbackCount" type="{}playbackCountInt" default="1" />
       <attribute name="deferStop" type="{http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema}boolean" default="false" />
       <attribute name="playbackMode" type="{}SoundPlaybackMode" default="SEQUENTIAL" />
       <attribute name="gain" type="{}gainFloat" default="1.0" />
       <attribute name="gainVariationPercent" type="{http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema}float" default="0.0" />
       <attribute name="pitch" type="{}pitchFloat" default="1.0" />
       <attribute name="pitchVariationPercent" type="{http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema}float" default="0.0" />
     </extension>
   </complexContent>
 </complexType>

Method Detail

getAudioDataReferences

public java.util.List<AudioDataReference> getAudioDataReferences()
Gets the value of the audioDataReferences property.

This accessor method returns a reference to the live list, not a snapshot. Therefore any modification you make to the returned list will be present inside the JAXB object. This is why there is not a set method for the audioDataReferences property.

For example, to add a new item, do as follows: 

    getAudioDataReferences().add(newItem);

Objects of the following type(s) are allowed in the list AudioDataReference
